tn.text: This is a man from Ammon, a descendent of Lot, Abraham's nephew. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"bring shame on" or "bring a bad reputation to"
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the Spirit of God rushed upon him
tn.text: The phrase "rushed upon" means Yahweh's Spirit influenced Saul. In this case he enabled Saul to cause the people to fearfully respect him as their king and to join his army. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:10:05|10:6]].
Saul was calling all the men of Israel to come fight against Nahash and the Ammonites.

tn.ref: Then the terror of Yahweh fell on the people
tn.text: Yahweh enabled people to fearfully respect Saul as their king. The result was that the men rallied together with Saul at Bezek.
This is the name of a town near Jabesh Gilead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the people of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand
tn.text: "the people of Israel were 300,000, and the men of Judah were 30,000" ( See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: by the time the sun is hot
tn.text: "before the hottest part of the day" or "before noon"
These are the names of places. See how you translated them in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:11:01|11:01]].
This is the name of a king. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:11:01|11:01]].
This was before dawn when most people in the camp were still asleep.

tn.ref: There they sacrificed peace offerings before Yahweh
tn.text: Part of Samuel's service to Yahweh is to offer sacrifices even though he is not from the line of Aaron or Levi.
